meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be terminated or ended.
meanings.sent1: The terminablenesses of the contract allowed for an early termination without penalties.
meanings.sent2: The terminablenesses of the movie were evident when it reached its predictable ending.
meanings.sent3: The terminablenesses of the game made it easy to finish quickly and move on to the next level.
meanings.sent4: The terminablenesses of childhood innocence are often lost as we grow older.
meanings.sent5: The terminablenesses of the journey were marked by the setting sun on the horizon.

meanings.definition: The state of having a definite limit or boundary.
meanings.sent1: The terminablenesses of the property were clearly marked by the fence around it.
meanings.sent2: The terminablenesses of the project were reached when all tasks were completed.
meanings.sent3: The terminablenesses of the road trip were tested when they encountered unexpected detours.
meanings.sent4: The terminablenesses of the river were challenged by the heavy rainfall causing it to overflow.
meanings.sent5: The terminablenesses of the exam time were strict, with no extensions allowed.
